programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are in Russia as the motoring magazine returns, taking part in a race across the urban landscape of St Petersburg. James defends the honour of the car in a very small Renault, Richard tries to prove that pedalling is faster by riding a bicycle, while Jeremy attempts to demonstrate that water is the quickest way across town by piloting a hovercraft. To make matters more complicated, all three presenters are racing not only one another but also the Stig, who is making his way toward the finish line by public transport. Plus, the new Lamborghini Huracan is put through its paces and singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran takes to the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters embark on a road trip across Australia's Northern Territory in fast, luxurious GT cars, with Jeremy Clarkson choosing a BMW M6 Gran Coupe, Richard Hammond picking a Bentley Continental GT V8 and James May opting for a Nissan GT-R. The trio set out on an adventure that takes in crocodile-infested rivers, a race around a vast opencast mine and an encounter with one of the world's longest lorries, concluding with an unusual challenge involving a farm, their cars and 4,000 cows. Plus, 24 star Kiefer Sutherland takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Room 101

programme.title: Room 101

programme.title: Room 101

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy becomes a relationship counsellor, so Lee and his father take advantage of her new-found skills in an effort to patch things up between them. Can they finally forgive and forget? Bobby Ball guest stars as Frank, with Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.desc: Dave invents a newish game show, and considers subjects from threats that are not threatening. He also examines the evolution of the Honey Monster, the shyness of elks, and the naming of insects.

programme.desc: Brian has been captured and forced to perform in a sinister circus, run by the cheerily sadistic Feffenhoffer, played by guest star Steve Coogan.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian pitches for a job in the pub while Herman helps an old warrior friend. Barbara finds herself in charge of the Munty Pet show, which Howell is attempting to fix.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian introduces popcorn to Munty, Barbara dreams of becoming one of the famous Munty Clack Dancers and Howell makes a truth potion for Slasher Morgan - with disastrous results.

programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food takes a gastronomic tour along the canal systems of southern France, from Bordeaux to Marseille. He samples seafood and regional cuisine, as well as exploring a variety of traditional recipes, including artichoke salad with poached egg, eels in cider, and bass with beurre blanc.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food explores the banks of the River Garonne on board a 100-year-old converted barge, and savours the delights of French provincial cooking including magret de canard and petit sale. Other dishes featured are clams in white garlic sauce, eels in parsley and garlic butter, and steak tartare.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Houston, Eddie faces the 'grim reaper' in a crawfish challenge featuring the fearsome reaper pepper. He also devours some southern comfort food and pulls a plane down a runway.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall follows in Rocky's footsteps with physical challenges at a famed Philadelphia boxing gym - and his very own hunger games in the infamous Philly Cheesesteak Challenge.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of rock climbers head to the desert of southern Oman to attempt the first ascent of a towering escarpment, hoping to discover the rare and elusive Arabian leopard.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are in Russia as the motoring magazine returns, taking part in a race across the urban landscape of St Petersburg. James defends the honour of the car in a very small Renault, Richard tries to prove that pedalling is faster by riding a bicycle, while Jeremy attempts to demonstrate that water is the quickest way across town by piloting a hovercraft. To make matters more complicated, all three presenters are racing not only one another but also the Stig, who is making his way toward the finish line by public transport. Plus, the new Lamborghini Huracan is put through its paces and singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran takes to the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters embark on a road trip across Australia's Northern Territory in fast, luxurious GT cars, with Jeremy Clarkson choosing a BMW M6 Gran Coupe, Richard Hammond picking a Bentley Continental GT V8 and James May opting for a Nissan GT-R. The trio set out on an adventure that takes in crocodile-infested rivers, a race around a vast opencast mine and an encounter with one of the world's longest lorries, concluding with an unusual challenge involving a farm, their cars and 4,000 cows. Plus, 24 star Kiefer Sutherland takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Elysian Park in Los Angeles is turned into an obstacle-littered course for the day as 70 teams of adrenaline junkies put their gravity-powered contraptions to the test.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The competing teams' motorless vehicles use gravity as their only form of propulsion in the Belgian capital of Brussels.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Inspector Dave Corcoran calls on his friend to turn what looks like a tug boat into a police vessel. Meanwhile, the team fix up a car whose tyres were slashed whilst on duty.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner presents the comedy panel show, which sees chef and MasterChef judge John Torode, comedian Russell Howard and actress Katherine Parkinson compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include massive pepper grinders, grumpy kids and DJs who join in at the end of a song.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedy actress Catherine Tate, X Factor contender-turned-television host Rylan Clark-Neal and veteran actor Nigel Havers to vent their spleen about people and objects that upset them. Their gripes include hipster restaurants, set-up paparazzi shoots and Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian David Mitchell, tennis coach Judy Murray and Countryfile presenter Anita Rani to vent their spleen about people and objects that upset them. Their gripes include sniffing, walking and eating, and sugar lumps.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the Brazil event, in which teams of amateur racers design and build their own gravity-powered soapbox vehicles and race them in an extreme downhill battle.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness, Freddie Flintoff and Chris Harris are sent on a high-altitude mountain expedition across Peru in second-hand American cars. Plus, back at the track, Chris tests out the latest electric car from Porsche.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of rock climbers head to the desert of southern Oman to attempt the first ascent of a towering escarpment, hoping to discover the rare and elusive Arabian leopard.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Match of the Day presenter Gary Lineker takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Tom Allen and political commentator Ayesha Hazarika joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: An extended edition of the quiz show, in which question-master Stephen Fry muddles through the middle show of the middle series as comedians Jimmy Carr, Aisling Bea and Danny Bhoy compete alongside resident panellist Alan Davies. As usual, points are awarded for the answers the host finds most interesting, regardless of whether or not they are correct.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Ed Byrne, Angela Barnes, Geoff Norcott
programme.desc: Ed Byrne plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by Angela Barnes and Geoff Norcott.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Ed Gamble, Ivo Graham and Romesh Ranganathan join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation. First shown in September 2016.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Independent Group MP Heidi Allen and stand-up Phil Wang joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Olympic cycling gold-medallist Chris Hoy, impressionist Ronni Ancona, writer and producer Danny Wallace and sports presenter Gabby Logan join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Tom Allen, Felicity Ward, Sue Perkins and Alex Brooker are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: Josh gets dumped by his girlfriend, so Owen takes him on a double date with a couple of voracious older women. Meanwhile, an e-mail mix-up leads to Kate breaking Geoff's heart. Sitcom, co-written by and starring Josh Widdicombe, with Elis James, Beattie Edmondson and Jack Dee.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: From World War to Cold War
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary exploring the end of the Second World War, and how the plans for the future agreed by the Allied nations at the Yalta Conference in 1945 broke down.

programme.title: From World War to Cold War
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring the end of the Second World War, and how the plans for the future agreed by the Allied nations at the Yalta Conference in 1945 broke down.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Diary of Anne Frank: A Tale of Two Sisters
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of Anne Frank and Eva Schloss, whose lives intertwined during the darkest of period of 20th-century history. Eva, who met Anne in Amsterdam in 1938, survived Auschwitz and here talks about her memories of the young diarist, her survival from the death camps, and how she became the step daughter of Anne's Father, Otto Frank.

programme.title: Samurai Warrior Queens
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary telling the story of Nakano Takeko, a female samurai who defied convention to lead a rebellion against Japan's western-influenced Emperor in 1868.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Lost Treasure of the Templars
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates whether the Knights Templar hid their treasure, looted from Jerusalem, on an uninhabited island in Mahone Bay, Nova Scotia.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: An examination of how Leon Degrelle and an array of Finns, Estonians and fellow Belgians joined German volunteer brigades to hold off the Red Army on the Eastern front during the Second World War and enabled 56,000 men to escape.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Account of Operation Barbarossa, Germany's plan to invade the Soviet Union in 1941, revealing the massive human and financial cost endured by the Soviet people, who fought a bloody and lonely war with little support from the Allies. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind an abandoned Second World War aviation facility in Farnborough, a Soviet airbase in the Gobi Desert, and a disused furnace in Pittsburgh.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The surprising preventive and curative 'medicine' developed by certain species, including the hippopotamus, which secretes a red slime to act as a highly efficient sun screen.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Two families with remarkable powers of regenerating unusually large body parts easily - salamanders, which do so when a large chunk, such as the tail or a limb, has been bitten off by a predator, and male moose, which grow and shed antlers every year.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James charts the history of 4x4 vehicles from the jeeps of the Second World war onwards, revealing how they rose in popularity in everyday use and in rallies. He explores the rivalry between Land Rover and Land Cruiser, and puts some classic vehicles through their paces by driving up Mount Fuji and through the Mojave desert.

programme.title: Madagascar
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes the wildlife of the desert-like west and south of the island, an area where dry spells can last months and survival is a struggle. Verreaux's sifakas live among trees with potentially lethal spikes, while the baobab trees house mouse lemurs, primates that feed on the droppings of fluffy bugs. During the toughest time of year, gangs of ring-tailed lemurs try to raise their young, and as the rains arrive, the year-long life cycle of the Labord's chameleon begins.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Examining a fleet of cruise ships that are the largest passenger vessels in the world, and revealing how they have built on 19th-century experiments in hydrodynamics.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: Documentary about the Holocaust and some of the key figures involved, beginning with Hjalmar Schacht, who was never a Nazi but played a vital role in Hitler's plans.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: British bombers are unable to hit their targets precisely and attack German cities under cover of darkness, while the Blitz in Britain brings public demand for revenge strikes, and Arthur Harris takes charge of Bomber Command.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A village ruin that is now pitted and scarred, a ghostly fleet of ships, a bridge to nowhere hidden in a forest and strange metal structures in a wood.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: The crew visits Germany to collect a multi-million-pound maintenance machine so large it will need to be loaded onto two trucks. Eric and Chris oversee a diesel-engine exchange.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright comes up with a cunning plan and invents a Saint's day so that Granville can check the pockets of a foreign visitor who he suspects of shoplifting.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: An Errand Boy by the Ear

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of London's Shard, revealing how it was influenced by the Milan Metro, concrete grain storage in Minnesota and a lifting mechanism in the Venice shipyards.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine

programme.title: The World at War

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The story of how a town established by Henry Ford in the 1920s has been left to rot in the Amazonian rainforest. Plus, Mysterious monoliths scattered over a Polish forest.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. programme.desc: The stories behind the most important trains in history and their impact on the world, beginning with a look at the first locomotives during the Industrial Revolution.

programme.desc: Exploring Victoria Falls, where the Zambezi River creates the largest sheet of falling water in the world.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the US navy's most advanced nuclear submarine - which can remain underwater for months at a time - examining the previous vessels that influenced it.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The establishment of the concentration camps, revealing how quickly a system of concentration populations turned into a tool for mass murder.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The longest retreat in British military history, when Allied troops defending Burma in 1942 were confronted by Japanese forces well prepared for jungle warfare. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Series exploring ruined engineering projects that have been put to alternative use, including the site of the Chernobyl disaster and a Nazi holiday complex.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Devious royal butler Edmund Blackadder steps in to foil a plan by new prime minister Pitt the Younger to bankrupt his master the Prince Regent - but as usual his intentions are not particularly honourable. Rowan Atkinson, Hugh Laurie and Tony Robinson star.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Dr Johnson seeks Prince George's support in publishing his new dictionary, but brainless Baldrick burns the only copy. Edmund sets out to save the English language by rewriting the great man's masterpiece - but he has only one night to complete it. Comedy, guest starring Robbie Coltrane, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: After Edmund scorns the exploits of the Scarlet Pimpernel, two noblemen bet him 1,000 guineas that he can't go to France and rescue an aristocrat. Instead, he finds the Comte de Frou Frou at Mrs Miggins' pie shop and takes him to the French embassy, but ends up being arrested by a revolutionary who has assassinated the ambassador. Comedy, guest starring Nigel Planer, Tim McInnerny and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The longest retreat in British military history, when Allied troops defending Burma in 1942 were confronted by Japanese forces well prepared for jungle warfare. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The Diary of Anne Frank: A Tale of Two Sisters
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of Anne Frank and Eva Schloss, whose lives intertwined during the darkest of period of 20th-century history. Eva, who met Anne in Amsterdam in 1938, survived Auschwitz and here talks about her memories of the young diarist, her survival from the death camps, and how she became the step daughter of Anne's Father, Otto Frank.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver meets historian Collum MacNeil on the deserted island of Mingulay, and discovers why it was abandoned in 1912 after 2,000 years of habitation. Miranda Krestovnikoff learns the truth behind the classic Ealing comedy Whisky Galore! on Eriskay, and chemist Mike Bullivant tries to recreate a 19th-century experiment to turn peaty soil into oil.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Jerusalem in search of Solomon's Temple. When the Romans sacked the city in 70AD, the fabled Treasure of Solomons was believed to have been looted and taken back to Rome. However, it is possible it was hidden away by the High Priests. Archaeologists Dr Shimon Gibson and Kate Raphael have dedicated their lives working out what actually happened, and discuss whether it is possible that Solomonic and Roman treasures lie undiscovered under Jerusalem.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The history of the concentration camp, charting its origins as a place to hold political prisoners through its development into a mechanised factory for mass murder. The first episode features the accounts of Polish inmates held there prior to the Holocaust, Jewish survivors and a former SS officer, who discusses being placed in charge of a firing squad.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Luftwaffe's bombing raids on Britain's provincial cities, when Coventry and Plymouth were hardest hit, although Portsmouth, Glasgow, Sheffield and Bristol also suffered heavy casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A highway built in the Brazilian jungle as an escape route in the event of an emergency at a nuclear power station, a Soviet fortress and Ellis Island hospital.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How the steam train reached the height of its importance in Europe just as fresh innovations were being made in America, with groundbreaking trains like the Burlington Zephyr.

programme.title: Remarkable Rwanda
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the diverse and different aspects of the African country, from magnificent mountain gorillas to one of the world's largest colobus monkey colonies.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the region's islands, which are home to a vast array of extraordinary wildlife. The programme reveals how remote human communities native to the area are surrounded by harsh terrain and subjected to extreme weather conditions. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: How the world's biggest ship, designed to install oil platforms and lay pipelines, was inspired by a logging machine, a wire rope and 1940s shipbuilding techniques.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at the early stages of genocide at the camp, examining the role of commander Rudolf Hoess in the process. Featuring contributions from survivors.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver meets historian Collum MacNeil on the deserted island of Mingulay, and discovers why it was abandoned in 1912 after 2,000 years of habitation. Miranda Krestovnikoff learns the truth behind the classic Ealing comedy Whisky Galore! on Eriskay, and chemist Mike Bullivant tries to recreate a 19th-century experiment to turn peaty soil into oil.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver admires ginger seals at Walton-on-the-Naze, while Nick Crane examines the area's fossil record. Miranda Krestovnikoff explores research into the thornback ray on the Thames Estuary and how it aids conservation. The team also visits Felixstowe, the UK's busiest container port, where HM Revenue and Customs uncover a stash of cocaine smuggled among furniture.

programme.title: Deadliest Crash: Disaster at Le Mans
programme.desc: Documentary examining what caused Pierre Levegh's Mercedes to crash into the crowd during the 1955 Le Mans 24-hour race, killing more than 80 people - an accident that remains the worst in the history of motor racing. Among the theories discussed are the use of untested technologies by the car's manufacturers, the addition of a lethal fuel additive and allegations of reckless driving by future Formula One world champion Mike Hawthorn, who won the race with Jaguar team partner Ivor Bueb. Narrated by Jack Deam.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The theories surrounding the death of Hermann Goering, who managed to cheat the hangman by taking a cyanide capsule on the day before his scheduled death.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A widow reluctantly parts with her husband's treasured collection of Rolls Royces and Bentleys, and an impulse buyer finds one of the cars a new home.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a car auction business. A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team struggles to explain how a DAF 33 gearbox works, and office manager Sarah attempts to bring order to the auto memorabilia sale.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Following the wildlife that inhabits the famous American national park, a lost world of deep forests, vast plains and bubbling geysers. The first episode focuses on a variety of species as they struggle to survive the rigours of a freezing six-month winter, revealing that although the herds of elk and bison are weakened by the cold, one animal gets stronger - the wolf.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Summer returns, transforming the landscape of the famous national park from a frozen wilderness into the ideal environment for newborn animals. As temperatures rise, grizzly bears teach their young the secrets of survival - but even at this time of year, snow can sweep down from the mountains without warning.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: An early dusting of snow signals the end of autumn, a time when the forests are a blaze of red and gold and the animals prepare for the coming cold. The elk face hungry wolves as they move down from the mountains to feed in the valleys, while beavers rush to defend their habitat against the destructive ice, repairing dams and stocking underwater larders before the waters freeze over.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Music from the flower power era, featuring bands including Herman's Hermits, the Crazy World of Arthur Brown, the Alan Price Set, Manfred Mann and the Rolling Stones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Archive clips featuring solo artists, including music by performers as diverse as Sandie Shaw, Dusty Springfield, Long John Baldry, Lulu, Tom Jones, Brenton Wood, Cliff Richard, Cilla Black and Peter Sarstedt.

programme.title: Princess Margaret: The Rebel Royal
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary profile of the Queen's sister, whose life and loves reflected the social and sexual revolution that transformed Britain during the 20th century. With archive footage and interviews, the series follows Margaret's life as she redefined the image of the modern princess, and begins with her birth in 1930. The abdication of her uncle propelled Margaret to second in line to the throne, but her life would be shaped by dramatic social change as Britain entered a more egalitarian era after the Second World War.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: Documentary chronicling a year in the existence of 1,000-year-old Windsor Castle and its inhabitants, from the housekeeper and chefs to the Queen herself, who has allowed her public and private life to be documented more extensively than ever before. The state visit of former President of France Jacques Chirac sees the staff organise a banquet and a performance of a West End musical inside the building - but protesters outside threaten to mar proceedings.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn explores the disused tube station Down Street in Mayfair, that played a crucial tactical role during the Second World War, and tours Rotterdam's new Centraal station with the man who designed it.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Constructing the Gotthard Base Tunnel in Switzerland, the longest rail tunnel in the world, running for 57 kilometres through the Alps.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre uses the SAS archives to examine the history of the British Army special forces unit combining documents, unseen footage and interviews with its founding members to tell the remarkable story behind an extraordinary fighting force. In the first edition, he looks at its formation in the heat of the north African desert in 1941, when eccentric young British army officer David Archibald Stirling had a vision for a new kind of war in which the enemy was attacked from behind their own lines.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: British bombers are unable to hit their targets precisely and attack German cities under cover of darkness, while the Blitz in Britain brings public demand for revenge strikes, and Arthur Harris takes charge of Bomber Command.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Churchill's plan to attack Germany through Italy. Although considered the simplest military solution, the Allies were to face formidable opposition, while the Americans met the Wehrmacht for the first time. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The longest retreat in British military history, when Allied troops defending Burma in 1942 were confronted by Japanese forces well prepared for jungle warfare. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Luftwaffe's bombing raids on Britain's provincial cities, when Coventry and Plymouth were hardest hit, although Portsmouth, Glasgow, Sheffield and Bristol also suffered heavy casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre concludes his history of formation of the British Army special forces unit. With David Stirling locked away in Hitler's most secure prison Colditz, the leadership of the SAS passed to Paddy Mayne, a man who built his reputation on the battlefield as a warrior of the first rank. In 1943, the SAS leaves the desert for Europe to enter a darker and far more complex theatre of war, where they face the threat of execution and the trauma of civilian casualties, as well as being the first to witness the nightmare of Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: After the death of Cardinal Wolsey in 1530, Thomas Cromwell became Henry VIII's 'lap dog'. In order to do the king's bidding, he established a network of spies that steered Henry through his troubles with Rome, divorces, assassinations attempts and the establishment of a new religion. as this documentary reveals, though cunning and ambitious, none of these achievements proved sufficient to preserve his life.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston talks to author Joy Hancox about the alchemical roots of London, the design of famous buildings such as The Globe theatre and the mysterious figure of English poet John Byrom. He also meets a modern day potion-maker.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The historical importance of freight trains, including four-mile long vehicles transporting enough iron ore to build two Eiffel towers.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Colin Salmon narrates a documentary exploring how the lives of humans and animals across a vast area of the planet are affected by the transforming power of the monsoon rains. The end of the dry season in northern Australia sees 300,000 flying foxes gathering to drink while running a gauntlet of freshwater crocodiles, while in Sumatra a female orang-utan guides her youngster to where she knows a fig tree fruits at this time of year. At the Delhi stock exchange, the price of rice escalates every day the rains fail to materialise and priests submerge themselves in water and beseech Varuna, god of water, to come.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: A look at how the 20,000 islands in the region became colonised by humans and animals. For the Polynesians, the Pacific's first people, their journeys constituted a feat of navigational ingenuity, while animals often had to rely on violent forces of nature, such as cyclones and tsunamis, to reach the shores.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The largest and most sophisticated radio telescope on the planet, which draws inspiration from geodesic dome designs and the work of 18th-century engineer Jean Marie Jacquard.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: Examining the complex system the Nazis set up to implement the extermination of the Jewish race throughout Europe from 1942, with Auschwitz as the hub. The programme reveals that at other camps, including Treblinka, Belzec and Sobibor, rival commanders participated in the genocide with enthusiasm and shared ideas for the best method of mass murder.

programme.title: The World at War

programme.desc: Sarah leads the charge to rescue James, whose ordeal continues when his sexuality becomes known, and puts her relationship with George at risk when a disturbing discovery forces her to reveal her darkest secret.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah reveals her horrific secret to George, and their relationship is suddenly thrown into doubt. The Christmas soiree brings out Jack's intimacy issues, and Anna publicly humiliates Andrew. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.desc: Sean is devastated to discover the truth about Max and Tina, and Adam feels pressured to reveal his secret. Meanwhile, Patrick is amazed when a blind man inexplicably regains his sight - could it be a miracle? Medical drama, starring Gerald Kyd, Pal Aron and Ian Kelsey.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Killer - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of three. Peter Baxter is released on bail, even though there is evidence linking him to the disappearance of nurse Manisha Devi - but the subsequent discovery of her burnt body raises the possibility that a dreadful mistake has been made. Samantha presses ahead with the investigation, and identifies another suspect in the form of taxi driver David Russo. Unfortunately, she isn't aware that Ramani is already in the back of his cab, being driven through the streets of Sun Hill by someone who may be a killer.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon and Grant are on a romantic weekend and Phil and Kathy are getting to know each other better. Meanwhile Frank and Pat are visiting Diane who is heavily pregnant.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Richard goes green with jealousy when he sees Phil and Kathy together, Nigel confronts Nick as he tries to steal his mothers furniture and Arthur comes clean about his double life.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Angry protestors plant a fire-bomb in a chemist's shop, unaware the manager is still on the premises. Billy finally meets his mother, and Hallam fends off lovelorn student Jenny.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Lexie is annoyed when her estranged father arrives in Glenbogle, but he soon sets about charming the rest of the MacDonald clan with his tall stories. Molly and Golly pose as a married couple to buy a horse, but are forced to keep up the pretence for longer than they anticipated, and Duncan's plans to impress Jess go awry when it becomes clear they have very different tastes in interior decoration.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The locals bid an emotional farewell to Vic and Lucy, and Simon's problems continue to mount as his business crumbles and he is consumed by guilt over his fling with Evelyn. Elsewhere, a dishy gardener steals the heart of a wheelchair-bound patient, while Tom and Beth take advantage of a drunken Joe's incapacity and steal a kiss. Rural drama, starring Thomas Craig and Tony Haygarth.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: The sisters face up to the realities of life with their husbands in prison, and try to explain things to Tracey's son, Garth. Classic comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene allows Boycie to buy a maximum of six cows for the farm - and is less than impressed when Elgin, Jed and Bryan turn up with a herd of 300. The vet is called out when Rocky the bull fails to take any notice of the females, and Tyler prepares to sit a local private school's entrance exam. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel is concerned that he has no pension plans, so the ever-resourceful Alistair comes up with an ingenious idea - to sell the country house. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo's nephew is getting married, and while the groom's uncle considers having a bath to mark the occasion, Foggy fears disaster will befall the happy couple.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The judge presides over the case of a man who killed a paedophile, an act that Jo defends by arguing it protected further victims from abuse. Meanwhile, she meets the real father of the boy she is trying to adopt, and begins seeing him socially - sending Deed into a fit of jealous rage. Martin Shaw and Jenny Seagrove star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reinvestigates the murder of a man found in an alleyway seven years previously when he is identified on a website covering unexplained disappearances. The victim is named by a woman whose husband hired him six months before his death, but neither of them had thought anything of it when their employee went missing - and seem to know little about him. Meanwhile, Brian and Gerry are distracted by looming job cuts and fear that Ucos could be downsized. With Robert Daws and Claudie Blakley.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A woman who went missing from a care home in 1986 is found murdered in a burnt-out car, and the team discovers she had recently abducted a teenage girl herself. As the investigation continues, both cases appear to be linked to an urban myth about a character known as the Bag Man - an eyeless villain who kidnaps children. With Eva Birthistle, Tara FitzGerald and Wil Johnson.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages and picking up as the tumultuous War of the Roses comes to an end, a new generation ascends to the throne in a tale of power, political clashes, family, love and betrayal. As the victor of the Battle of Bosworth, Henry Tudor, is set to ascend the throne and Elizabeth of York and her family, supporters of the former King, find themselves in grave danger. Lizzie must fulfil her promise to marry King Henry VII and bring peace to the nation. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII sets out to establish himself as the new sovereign, but finds a dangerous, deeply divided kingdom. Lizzie's loyalties are further complicated by the child she is expecting. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Elizabeth decides to organise a formal party to demonstrate how out of her depth Sarah is. Meanwhile, Carolyn is shocked by Jack's revelation when she challenges him to confront his intimacy issues, and Regina returns home from Europe with news about Sarah. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah is closer to George than ever after her triumph at the Swansons' party. However, their happiness is short-lived when they are faced with Regina's bombshell, which sends shockwaves through Inverness. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Killer - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of three. Peter Baxter is released on bail, even though there is evidence linking him to the disappearance of nurse Manisha Devi - but the subsequent discovery of her burnt body raises the possibility that a dreadful mistake has been made. Samantha presses ahead with the investigation, and identifies another suspect in the form of taxi driver David Russo. Unfortunately, she isn't aware that Ramani is already in the back of his cab, being driven through the streets of Sun Hill by someone who may be a killer.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane is told to work under Ric's supervision when she is blamed for Helen's death, but she is determined to clear her name and attempts to secretly record Nick confessing to his error. A new assistant general manager starts work at the hospital, and soon invites Donna to the May ball, while Matt gets a second job in the admin department to pay off his debts.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Amy plucks up the courage to audition for a band and a hungover Sean is forced to rethink his life when a friend needs his help. Tim Jenkins, an old friend of Sean's, overdoses.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Killer - Part Three
programme.desc: Part three of three. A DNA sample seems to rule out cabbie David Russo as the murderer of nurse Manisha Devi - until it transpires that he has cancer and recently underwent a blood transfusion that could have affected the test result. Peter Baxter is stabbed by a traumatised Ruth Cohen, while June has a run-in with a 13-year-old arson suspect and later calls the station to report a rape - naming herself as victim.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur finally confesses everything to Pauline.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline kicks Arthur out after he discloses his affair with Mrs Hewett, with Michelle, Mark and Kathy drawn into the crossfire.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: George, Kevin and Bayleaf train with the new brigade helicopter, while back on the ground, their Blue Watch partners-in-peril tackle a terrifying bedsit blaze.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Paul tries to make his mark on Glenbogle but quickly runs into trouble, in the form of new arrival Isobel, while an unexpected visit from Lexie causes heartbreak for Duncan. Molly is horrified to learn there is a thief on the estate, while Highland Radio Authority officer Parker is on the trail of pirate station Rob Roy Radio. Drama, starring Susan Hampshire, Dawn Steele and Hamish Clark.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The Skelthwaite Scorpions play a crunch match against rival team the Bridlington Trawlers, but fare badly, prompting David to demand a return engagement. Meanwhile, Anna's distress at her split with Simon is compounded by the financial hardship of running a business single-handed _ but just as disaster looms, a shady businessman makes her an offer for the factory. Lesley Dunlop and Philip Middlemiss star.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon spreads her wings and takes full advantage of her sister's hospitality, but Tracey is having money worries. Ross Kemp guest stars, with Linda Robson and Pauline Quirke.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie struggles to come to terms with the news that his prize bull is gay, and Marlene finds she is missing the noise of the city after suffering sleepless nights. Tyler is delighted to learn he has failed all but two of his GCSEs, thinking he will no longer be accepted at a private school - but his parents have other ideas. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean decides to go online, but Lionel is not so sure it is a good idea, and Judith's ex-boyfriend Alistair comes up against a big problem. Comedy about late-blossoming love, with Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy tries to implement a new fitness regime, but Clegg is reluctant to take part and insists some of the world's nicest people are out of shape. Brian Wilde stars.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: Bacchus and Gently arrive in a small town to investigate the apparent suicide of a mill manager who has been found hanged. However, the detectives begin to suspect foul play as they discover money has gone missing and the victim's widow reveals he was having an affair. Starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates the killing of a zookeeper, thought to have been mauled to death by a tiger in 2006, when blood found in the victim's lodgings suggests he was murdered before his body was placed in the big-cat enclosure. However, not all the team members are happy about the new case as Brian's animal rights tendencies come to the fore, bringing him into conflict with the zoo's PR. Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman star.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The body of a Falklands War veteran who became one of the leading lights in the campaign against nuclear weapons is found in a stretch of river running underneath the Ministry of Defence. As Boyd and the team set about investigating the man's former allies, they stumble upon footage of an incident intelligence services had tried to cover up - and Grace is reunited with a former lover from her own time in the anti-nuclear movement. Drama, starring Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston, with Jack Shepherd (Wycliffe, Into the Storm), John McArdle (Brookside) and Anna Chancellor (Four Weddings and a Funeral, Spooks).

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Elizabeth struggles through her labour, while King Henry's envoys embark on a diplomatic mission to Burgundy, a York stronghold abroad. Negotiations are jeopardised by a twist of fate, and Lizzie learns she has more in common with her husband than she first imagined. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The York princesses are strategically married off to strengthen the Tudor cause, but further political challenges are on the horizon. When King Henry finds himself back on the battlefield to protect his reign, Lizzie learns that the threats they face may be closer to home. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah arrives in Paris, hoping to reconnect with her husband, and is shocked by what she finds. Elizabeth pushes George to be truthful, but causes more damage to their already fragile relationship. Regina puts the next stage of her plan into action, and while Anna finds out the truth about her real father, Olivia proves the depths she is prepared to go to in order to save her marriage.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah returns to Inverness with Rene, but may have underestimated her feelings for George. Olivia finds the burden of deception weighs heavily, while Anna and Gino prepare for their wedding day.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Killer - Part Three
programme.desc: Part three of three. A DNA sample seems to rule out cabbie David Russo as the murderer of nurse Manisha Devi - until it transpires that he has cancer and recently underwent a blood transfusion that could have affected the test result. Peter Baxter is stabbed by a traumatised Ruth Cohen, while June has a run-in with a 13-year-old arson suspect and later calls the station to report a rape - naming herself as victim.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Abra supervises Diane as he covers for Ric for a fortnight, and reveals he would be keen to work at the hospital permanently - but his determination to perform an operation tempts him to bend the rules, and ruins his chances. Tricia tells Chrissie about her relationship with Mark, and decides to have her surgery moved forward.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Josh and Penny are called to deliver a baby in unusual circumstances, and Max faces his worst nightmare as his son is brought in for emergency treatment. Meanwhile, identical twins are reunited for the first time in 28 years by an accident. Medical drama, starring Ian Bleasdale and Donna Alexander.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Teenage rapist Ross Trescot is brought into custody, but his arrest does little to comfort June, who insists in being interviewed by Sheelagh, unable to bear the thought of reliving her ordeal with a stranger. Yvonne also faces a stressful time as she gives evidence at the inquest into Lee Thomas's death. Colleagues support her during the day, but a verdict of unlawful killing is recorded and she faces the unsettling prospect of being charged with murder. Away from the line of duty, Phil Hunter grows increasingly uneasy as Kate plans their wedding and finally admits he is still married to Cindy - prompting her to throw him out of the house.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur frets over not being able to see his son after the fall out of Pauline finding out about his affair. Michelle confront Ms. Hewitt about wreaking her parents marriage.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur and Chrissy are both having marriage problems. Will Adrian and Mandy get jobs to put food on the table. Sanjay know Geetas sister Meena is up to no good!.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch return to the scene of a fire in the basement of a house converted into bedsits. Meanwhile, Recall says goodbye to his family as they move to Scotland without him.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Paul's errant uncle Donald MacDonald returns to Glenbogle after a 40-year absence, but his homecoming receives a mixed reaction. Lexie sets out to forget her marital problems by organising Molly's 60th birthday party, but the matriarch is not so keen to celebrate. Meanwhile, Isobel faces financial ruin after a contract to supply the estate with fresh bread and vegetables is cancelled, and Jess is concerned that she and Duncan are turning into a boring couple. Drama, guest starring Tom Baker, with Lloyd Owen, Susan Hampshire and Dawn Steele.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Karen is subjected to a horrific assault by the grandson of a pensioner in her care, while Luke gets into trouble at school and responds by running away, plunging Anna into a panic. On a happier note, Tom clinches an important business deal with German client Herr Gruber, while Joe contemplates moving in with Beth. Leslie Ash, Julian Lewis Jones and Lesley Dunlop star.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey makes an appointment with a Harley Street specialist, hoping to allay her suspicions that she may be pregnant. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene discovers the farmhands concocting a virility potion for Rocky the bull, and manages to sneak a dose into Boycie's coffee. Make-up is found in Tyler's room, and his parents are relieved to be told he has a girlfriend - until it transpires she is also his teacher. John Challis, Sue Holderness and Jack Doolan star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean is looking forward to the pitter-patter of tiny feet - despite the fact that daughter Judith is not even pregnant.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo tracks down his missing ferret to Nora's washing basket, but smuggling it out unnoticed proves tricky. Bill Owen and Kathy Staff star.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Lynley and Havers investigate when young lawyer Emily Proctor is found axed to death in Hyde Park. They are led to the chambers of a human rights barrister who was having an affair with her, and it isn't long before the victim's seedy double life involving Internet porn and dark family secrets emerges. Detective drama, starring Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Samuel West.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack announces he is quitting the team, but before Sandra, Brian and Gerry can question his reasons, shadowy Whitehall figure Stephen Fisher arrives with one of his secret cases - the unsolved murder of a woman dating back more than 160 years. With just 24 hours to solve it, will the sleuths find time to get to the bottom of Jack's shock decision and persuade him to stick around?.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team discovers a DNA match between a medical student reported missing six years previously and a corpse that was found at around the same time. Investigations into the man's background reveal he had been suspected of having links to terrorist organisations - but Boyd believes a high-level cover-up is obscuring the whole truth about the case. Guest starring Don Warrington.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Lizzie must deal with her mother's bold defence of the York cause, while the appearance of a boy in Burgundy claiming to be a young prince threatens to further destabilise King Henry's rule. King Henry's mother Lady Margaret Beaufort faces the consequences of harbouring a dark secret. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII and Lizzie travel to Spain to secure their son's betrothal, but find news of their country's instability has preceded them. Meanwhile, unrest growing in Burgundy spills over into an English battle. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Rene suspects he is standing in the way of Sarah's happiness after witnessing a moment of yearning, while Andrew disturbs Anna and Gino's honeymoon bliss. Elsewhere, George makes an announcement.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Military drama series charting the lives of the men and women of the King's Own Fusiliers regiment. In the opening episode, the officers return from a tour in Northern Ireland after tragedy strikes. Starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Teenage rapist Ross Trescot is brought into custody, but his arrest does little to comfort June, who insists in being interviewed by Sheelagh, unable to bear the thought of reliving her ordeal with a stranger. programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Chrissie panics when Don Bosman returns to the hospital to retrieve Helena's body and finds out her heart was donated without his consent. Dillon's condition worsens following his re-admission, leading Sam to discover he has failed to conquer his drinking habit. Meanwhile, jealousy gets the better of Kyla, who berates Justin for behaving unprofessionally after catching him flirting with Donna.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max gets in the way of the struggle to save his son Frank's life. Meanwhile, a bizarre coincidence reunites a mother and son, and Charlie's least favourite patient causes a scene. Hospital drama, starring Derek Thompson, Robert Gwilym and Ian Bleasdale.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: At the End of a Long Day
programme.desc: Yvonne sets off for Barton Street Station to face formal manslaughter charges but has a run-in with a drunk en route and ends up hitting him - which won't exactly count in her favour when she appears in court. Jo Masters discovers one of Phil's informants is dealing in drugs with the collusion of a crooked customs officer, while Roger and Dan find a missing schoolgirl in woodlands and realise she has just given birth - but can't see any sign of her baby.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Hattie is trying to find a solution about working for Ian. Pauline refuses to have Arthur back. Gita would like to visit her sick mother in India.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Chrissy has a plan but wants Arthur to support her, Frank is going out of his mind trying to find out news about his pregnant daughter.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Bayleaf hands in his resignation. Meanwhile, the fire-fighters are called to a fire at a registry office, and Remy and Kevin quarrel about Mickey.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: The legacy of Paul and Lexie's secret kiss strains relations between them, but despite initial reservations, she reconsiders her decision to leave Glenbogle. Duncan decides the time is right for him to make changes in his life, and steps in to help a begrudging Ewan out when an accident incapacitates him. Meanwhile, Duncan and Molly reveal details of a hidden past that threaten to have dramatic implications for the rest of the family.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna receives a poignant reminder of her painful break-up with Simon and the Lampards agonise over whether to let Oscar's real dad see him, afraid of the emotional consequences. Joe takes Beth's rejection badly, while Karen has a traumatic encounter with Garth at Tessie Banks' funeral and later finds herself forced to save his life in a tense scene on the edge of windswept Blackscar Top.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Dorien may have ulterior motives for inviting Tracey to a posh event, while Sharon makes a tidy profit out of fake Rolling Stones T-shirts. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie secretly buys a load of artificial fertiliser to help his supposedly organic crops - but is seen unloading it by a neighbour, who promptly phones the Agricultural Office to complain about his behaviour. Starring John Challis.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel are eager for Sandy and Harry's return from Canada.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Sid attempts to install a doorbell in his cafe, so Compo, Clegg and Foggy try to assist - with disastrous consequences. John Comer, Peter Sallis, Brian Wilde and Bill Owen star in Roy Clarke's long-running comedy.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The circus brings death to Kembleford when a clown is murdered, and Father Brown hunts the killer while trying to determine why a parishioner has agreed to marry the sinister wizard Welkin. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: Doctor Blake has to piece together arson and a fatal shooting of a farmer. Meanwhile, a leak to the paper concerning the medic creates difficulties for his relationship with Jean. Australian drama, starring Craig McLachlan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: In their first case without trusty colleague Jack, the team members reinvestigate the disappearance of PE teacher Jason Bowe when the remains of a body are discovered near the elite public boarding school where he taught. Unfortunately, their snooping could not have come at a worse time for the staff, who are preparing to welcome a local MP to open their new computer centre - but what they do glean tells them the dead man seemed very much a loner. However, it soon turns out he got on much better with his students, forming close and inappropriate relationships with several. But could his behaviour have rattled someone enough to kill him? Susannah Harker and Nicola Walker guest star.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Boyd learns he is being removed from the Cold Case unit. For his final job, he re-opens an investigation into the disappearance of 16 homeless teenagers between 1979 and 1982 - the first case he ever worked on. However, as the team struggles to find any new information, Grace worries about her colleague's reasons for revisiting his past - while a guilt-ridden Sarah becomes desperate to make amends for her role in Boyd's sacking. Sarring Trevor Eve, with Paul McGann.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: A pretender to the throne is held captive at court, confounding the Tudors, and creating a new rift in Lizzie and King Henry's marriage. Lizzie faces an impossible choice, and makes a risky move to try to eliminate the threat to her family. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The pretender exposes King Henry's weaknesses, while Lizzie confronts new demons and old curses. Concluding the sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages as the War of the Roses comes to an end. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Napier is intrigued by an ex-colonial couple recently returned from India who settle in Tannochbrae and refuse to have contact with their mysterious daughter. Starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Janet's maternal instincts are aroused by the discovery of a day-old baby abandoned on the doorstep of Arden House. Medical drama, with Annette Crosbie and David Rintoul.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A flag from the American War of Independence turns up in a local church and triggers a wave of public interest as a number of villagers come forward to claim it as their own. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish dealer tries to beat Charlie Gimbert to a priceless collection of Jewish antiques that has turned up in Essex. Alfred Marks guest stars with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Sean Bean returns as Bernard Cornwell's swashbuckling hero, this time setting out to rescue British deserters captured by Spanish rebel El Casco. Along the way he crosses swords with a fellow officer and come to the aid of a damsel in distress. Daragh O'Malley, Hugh Fraser and John Tams also star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Oz is forced to take radical action to ensure the boys do not come out of the bridge job penniless, but it seems unlikely that his unique brand of sexual charm will save the day - and his doubts about son Rod's masculinity do not do much to help his focus. Just as they seem doomed to fail, a mysterious stranger arrives. Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais's comedy drama, with Tim Healy, Jimmy Nail and Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Joe Saugus throws the lads a monetary lifeline, offering to buy the transporter bridge on behalf of his people, while Barry has a final showdown with Kadi and Tatiana. Believing their financial worries are finally over, the lads set off to oversee the construction process in Arizona - where a hostile reception awaits them. Timothy Spall, Jimmy Nail, Tim Healy and Bill Nighy star.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to create a restaurant garden on Italy's Ligurian coast, but it is not long before their working holiday is disrupted by a murder. Determined to solve the crime before returning home, they find themselves with no shortage of suspects - and matters are complicated further by a second death. Guest starring Suzanne Bertish (Rome) and Tristan Gemmill (Casualty), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: An archaeologist posing as Rosemary dies mysteriously during a dig for Anglo-Saxon artefacts in the grounds of Lord Engleton's stately home, presenting the duo with a fresh mystery to solve. The gardens are unaccountably blighted by yellowing, forcing the estate to close its gates to the public, and a second death suggests somebody will go to any lengths for a piece of British history. Guest starring Julian Wadham.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are called in to investigate when gardens entered for a village contest are attacked by a disease. Further sinister undercurrents are exposed when reigning champion Donald Westward is found dead and recriminations start to fly as buried rivalries come to the surface. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Alzheimer sufferer Edward Alderston comes under suspicion of involvement when an ex-finance company high-flyer responsible for the loss of many elderly people's life savings is found floating in a swimming pool with a samurai sword in his back.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: A series of murders occurs after Murdoch and Ogden's book is released, prompting a desperate search for the copycat killer.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: After a 10-year-old girl is injured in a petrol bomb attack by animal rights activists, an outraged Gene takes Alex to interview a veteran campaigner in jail. Though the prisoner is weak and incoherent after going on hunger strike, Alex is convinced he not only has details of planned attacks - he may also know about her own situation and be able to help her get home. Guest starring David Bradley and Rory Kinnear.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Gene receives a visit from Jackie Queen, a journalist from Manchester, who announces to the shocked superintendent she is pregnant with his baby. She is also investigating the disappearance of teenagers suspected of running away to London, so the team launches an investigation and a suspect is quickly identified. However, it becomes clear the man is being protected by someone within the Met. John Bowe and Ruth Millar guest star.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A family GP is accused of murdering his wife, and Kavanagh, back in chambers following compassionate leave, is assigned to his defence. As the trial progresses, the battling barrister gradually comes to realise just how much he has in common with his client. Also starring Tom Courtenay, Oliver Ford Davies, Nicholas Jones and Valerie Edmond.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Part one of two. Walker is assigned to investigate the discovery of a young woman's skeleton, found underneath the patio of what used to be a boarding house, but is paired with Pat's ex-boyfriend Jeff. Drama from Widows creator Lynda LaPlante, starring David Hayman and Paul Kynman.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Napier is intrigued by an ex-colonial couple recently returned from India who settle in Tannochbrae and refuse to have contact with their mysterious daughter. Starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

Gabriel invites Sheelagh back to his place in a bid to prove that he has finally managed to forget about Kerry Young, while Yvonne is summoned to hear her fate as the inquiry into the death of Lee Chapman concludes.
